project.teaser: TranSensus LCA aims to develop a baseline for a European-wide harmonised, commonly accepted and applied single life cycle assessment (LCA) approach for a zero-emission road transport system. Such a European single LCA approach is seen as a key element in achieving the Green...
project.objective: TranSensus LCA aims to develop a baseline for a European-wide harmonised, commonly accepted and applied single life cycle assessment (LCA) approach for a zero-emission road transport system. Such a European single LCA approach is seen as a key element in achieving the Green Deal targets, making Europe the first digitally enabled circular, climate-neutral and sustainable economy. Bringing together relevant stakeholders from industry and research, an evidence- and real-life data-based LCA approach will be conceptualised and harmonised embracing environmental, economic and social aspects. By consensus, TranSensus LCA will enable industry, mobility providers and planners to provide sustainable products and to optimise mobility solutions as needed to combat climate change.
project.title: Towards a European-wide harmonised, transport specific LCA Approach
project.keywords: LCA, S-LCA, harmonised approach, consensus building, ontology, LCI database

article.title: Life cycle assessment paves the way for zero-emission road transport

category.title: Project description
category.description: Article: description of linked project written by editorial team

result.title: Roadmap for implementation
result.description: This report outlines the roadmap for implementation of the elaborated and harmonised LCA approach on basis of the consensus reached among TranSensus LCA, advisory boards and liaison group.

result.title: Analysis of needs and gaps for the development of a harmonised LCA/S-LCA approach in the electromobility industry
result.description: Summary report of the identified needs and gaps to be addressed in a harmonised LCA/S-LCA approach.

result.title: Final report on stakeholder engagement
result.description: A final document will be compiled describing and reviewing all activities conducted to engage with all relevant stakeholders.

result.title: Report on interpretation, decision making and feasibility
result.description: This report summarises the findings of task 2.6 in which feasibility and applicability of the proposed LCA approach is being tested for defined use cases. It serves as input for the final revision and harmonisation of the elaborated overall approach.

result.title: Guidelines for on a consensus-based LCA approach for the electromobility value chain
result.description: This report is the actual guideline agreed upon among all stakeholders through consultations. The reports also contains recommdations towards standardisation.

result.title: Final harmonised approach
result.description: This report is an update of D 2.2 describing the further refinements of the intermediate conceptual apporach based on the discussions with the Advisory Boards and wider stakeholder audience.

result.title: Review of current practices of life cycle assessment in electric mobility: A first step towards method harmonization

details.authors: Eltohamy H.; Oers, L.F.C.M. van; Lindholm, J.; Raugei, M.; Lokesh, K.; Baars, J.; Husmann, J.; Hill, N.; Istrate, I.R.; Jose, D.; Tegstedt, F.; Beylot, A.; Menegazzi, P.; Guinee, J.B.; Steubing, B.R.P.

result.title: Project brand and general materials for dissemination
result.description: This report summarises the project brand such as logo homepage and other materials foreseen for the communication to the wider public as well as for dissemination eg standard presentation poster and flyers

result.title: Review of current practices on life cycle approaches along the electromobility value chain

details.authors: Hazem Eltohamy, Lauran van Oers, Julia Lindholm, Marco Raugei, Kadambari Lokesh, Joris Baars, Jana Husmann, Nikolas Hill, Robert Istrate, Davis Jose, Fredrik Tegstedt, Antoine Beylot, Pascal Menegazzi, Jeroen Guinée, Bernhard Steubing

result.title: Inconsistencies in handling of multifunctionality in the environmental footprint of electric vehicle batteries: a cross-industry analysis

details.authors: Jana Husmann; Stephen Northey; Antoine Beylot; Steffen Blömeke; Christoph Herrmann
details.journalTitle: The International Journal of Life Cycle Assessment

result.title: Dissemination material to promote the guidelines
result.description: This report describes and compiles the dissemination and communication materials promoting the elaborted guideline.

result.title: Ontology & management database
Summary and results of the evaluation, clus-tering and prioritisation of feedback from the advisory boards
result.description: Summary and analysis of the findings and feedback obtained from the advisory boards during consultation and harmonisation. Information compiled within this report will be fed back to WP 1 and WP 2.

result.title: Description of tools and processes for stakeholder engagement
result.description: This reports outline the strategy how to interact and how to engage the advisory boards as well as the wider stakeholder community from a process point of view eg identification of stakeholders and experts toos for public consultation how to spread information on expert WS and consultations etc

result.title: Ontology & management database
result.description: Description of a common ontology for an LCI database using FAIR principles. It will describe how social and economic aspects must adhere to the ontology as well as describing maintenance and update procedures / processes.

result.title: Definition of test cases and results
result.description: This report compiles and analysis the results of test cases conducted with the advisory boards applying the newly proposed approach. Focus is given on applicability and consistency from an industrial point of view. Results will be fed back to WP 2 and WP 4.

result.title: Review of current practices on life cycle approaches along the electromobility value chain
result.description: Overview and analysis of current applied tools methods and data sets

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - TranSensus LCA (Towards a European-wide harmonised, transport specific LCA Approach)
result.teaser: TranSensus LCA aims to pave the way towards a commonly accepted and applied single LCA approach for zero-emission road transport. TranSensus LCA will consider the battery value chain, the full vehicle (passenger and commercial vehicles, for the latter including fuel cells...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: Report on consensus building with the Liaison Group
result.description: The report describes /and critcally review) the activities performed in order to engage with the Liaison Group and the wider stakeholder community. The focus is on the process, finidngs and feedback related to content is described in WP 3 deliverables.

result.title: Data Management Plan
Analysis of needs and gaps for the development of a harmonised LCA/S-LCA approach in the electromobility industry

details.authors: A Beylot, S Muller, P Menegazzi, B Jaars, D Bartaune, H Eltohamy, B Steubing, C Mir, K Lokesh, M Raugai, N Hill, D Jose, M Traverson, R Nangah Mankaa, J Lindholm, N Elginoz, M Lidberg, S Yusufovska, A Wallender, F Tegstedt

result.title: Gaps and lack of harmonization in LCA of the electromobility sector: where do we stand and where could we go?

details.authors: Antoine Beylot, Marco Raugei, Hazem Eltohamy, Nikolas Hill, Pascal Menegazzi, Stéphanie Muller, Kadam Lokesh, Joris Baars, Diana Bartaune, Julia Lindholm, Fredrik Tegstedt, Nilay Elginoz Kanat, Mara Neef, Lasse Schmidt, Fabien Perdu, Marie Pinochet, Astu Sam Pratiwi, Ketan Vaidya, Benedicte Robertz, Jair Santillan-Saldivar, Jana Husmann, Bernhard Steubing
details.journalTitle: The International Journal of Life Cycle Assessment
details.publisher: Springer Science and Business Media LLC

result.title: Consolidated Guideline for a transport-specific Life Cycle Assessment
Report on transferability to other markets
result.description: This report summarise the study and its findings on the transferability of the TranSensus LCA approach to other industrial sectors.

result.title: Annotated table of content of the guidelines
result.description: This report contains the annotated table of content of the guideline to be prepared for a consenual framework for LCA for ZEV and battery value chain. The annotated table will include a brief description of content of each section of the guideline to be compiled.

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
